newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: CRICKET-MOHANTY MAKES MEMORABLE DEBUT FOR INDIA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-MOHANTY MAKES MEMORABLE DEBUT FOR INDIA.

text.p: Debashish Mohanty made a memorable debut for India by claiming the prize wicket of Sanath Jayasuriya in his third over as Sri Lanka reached 97 for two at lunch on the first day of the final test on Saturday.
Sri Lanka, put into bat after India won the toss at Colombo's Singhalese Sports Club, started with Jayasuriya taking up where he left off when he scored 340 in the first test.
He made 32, all off boundaries, before giving a catch to Sachin Tendulkar at first slip off Mohanty's bowling.
Indian seamer Venkatesh Prasad earlier bore the brunt of Jayasuriya's attack, being hit for 29 runs in his first spell of four overs.
Marvan Atapattu followed seven balls later, caught by Mohammed Azharuddin at slip off Prasad's bowling for 19.
Mahanama and Aravinda de Silva, who both made centuries in the first Test, then took Sri Lanka to lunch without further loss.
